problem_text:
6.6. Phragmen-Lindelöf principle for the p-Laplace equation
By [58], bounded solutions u(x) of the p-Laplace equation, 1 < p < n, with
zero Dirichlet data in a δ-neighborhood of a point O ∈ ∂Ω, admit the point-
wise majorant
C exp( −c ∫_{|x|}^{δ} ( capp(B_ρ \ Ω) / capp(B_ρ) )^{1/(p−1)} dρ/ρ ),
where
capp(F) = inf { ∥∇u∥_p^p_{L^p(R^n)} : u ∈ C_0^∞(R^n), u ≥ 1 on F }.
(6.6)
Problem. Prove the following conjecture. If the energy integral of u is diver-
gent, then, for 2r < δ,
∥u∥_{L^p(B_δ \ B_r)} ≥ c(δ)
 r^{(n−p)/(p−1)} exp( c ∫_{r}^{δ} ( capp(B_ρ \ Ω) / capp(B_ρ) ) dρ/ρ ).
This assertion was established for the linear uniformly elliptic equation
−∂/∂x_i ( a_{ij}(x) ∂u/∂x_j ) = 0
with measurable bounded coefficients in [55].
